CHAPTER ID 1 Approval of the Minutes of the two CARDINAL previous sittings SPEAKER ID 1 CARDINAL NAME President The Minutes PERSON of the sittings of Thursday 3 February and Monday DATE 14 February DATE have been distributed. The Minutes of 3 February DATE were originally distributed in Brussels GPE so perhaps this is why some Members did not receive them. P Are there any comments? P The Minutes were approved P SPEAKER ID 2 LANGUAGE ES NAME Medina Ortega Madam ORG President my habit is always to be here for the opening of the part session on Monday afternoons TIME at 5.00 p.m. TIME Yesterday DATE it was impossible for myself and many MEPs to be here because the 2.15 p.m. Air France ORG flight which normally brings us here was cancelled with no explanation from the airline and we therefore arrived very late. If Air France ORG insists on boycotting the European Parliament ORG we should take measures to prevent this occurring again. P SPEAKER ID 3 CARDINAL NAME President Thank you Mr Medina Ortega PERSON . I too wholeheartedly regret this situation. Would you be so kind as to write to me so that I have proof with which to tackle the competent authorities of both Air France ORG and the French Government ORG ? This situation really cannot continue and we must therefore protest most strongly. SPEAKER ID 4 LANGUAGE IT NAME Napolitano Madam ORG President I had the same experience as Mr Medina Ortega PERSON yesterday DATE . P I feel that the French NORP authorities which have the honour of housing the European Parliament ORG in Strasbourg GPE should be aware of their responsibility to ensure adequate connections with all the capitals of the Union. SPEAKER ID 5 CARDINAL NAME President Absolutely Mr PERSON Napolitano. Thank you. SPEAKER ID 6 CARDINAL NAME Lannoye Madam ORG President off the subject of aeroplane delays I wish to apologise for the absence yesterday of my colleague in the Group of the Greens European Free Alliance ORG Caroline Lucas PERSON who is a British NORP Member. She could not be here because she was arrested yesterday DATE morning TIME during an anti nuclear demonstration in Glasgow GPE . Although her identity was noted and her position as a Member of the European Parliament ORG was very apparent she was still held in custody all day DATE . I regard this as absolutely unacceptable and would ask you to contact the British NORP authorities in order to ensure that this does not happen again and that Mrs Lucas receives an apology. I have written to you in this respect together with my colleague Mrs Hautala PERSON . SPEAKER ID 7 CARDINAL NAME President Thank you Mr Lannoye PERSON . I have received your letter and have already contacted the British NORP Permanent Representative. SPEAKER ID 8 LANGUAGE DE NAME Stenzel Madam ORG President I should like to make a request in connection with today DATE s vote which I started to make yesterday DATE during the debate on the EQUAL ORG report. I should like the vote on the Community EQUAL ORG initiative to be postponed because we need a bit more time to negotiate an important point. I am optimistic and quite relaxed and confident about the vote we shall gain broad support for this opinion on EQUAL ORG . We just need a bit more time to work out the details on the asylum question and I would therefore request that the vote be postponed from this morning TIME . SPEAKER ID 9 CARDINAL NAME Miller Madam ORG President to follow on from the point that Mr Lannoye made Mrs Lucas was arrested just outside Glasgow PERSON for protesting against the Trident PRODUCT base at Faslane ORG . I have a lot of sympathy with that protest. I have however no sympathy for Mrs Lucas PERSON trying to hide behind her Parliamentary immunity. P I have also been arrested for protesting at Faslane ORG . I did not hide behind any immunity. I took the punishment that came to me. Mrs Lucas should do the same. SPEAKER ID 10 LANGUAGE IT NAME Ghilardotti Madam President I would like to comment on the request Mrs Stenzel PERSON has made to postpone the vote on the Community ORG initiative EQUAL until tomorrow DATE . P In fact this initiative was the subject of a very lively debate in committee and given that it is a major Commission proposal which refers to the agreements we reached last year DATE I consider it admissible. P We agree with Mrs Stenzel that the request to postpone the vote is admissible in the interests of achieving the greatest possible agreement between the groups so that Parliament ORG can express its position on this initiative with the broadest majority possible. SPEAKER ID 11 CARDINAL NAME President Does anyone want to speak against Mrs Stenzel s PERSON request as supported by Mrs Ghilardotti PERSON ? P If not then we will proceed to the vote. P Parliament ORG approved the request SPEAKER ID 12 CARDINAL NAME Corbett Madam ORG President under Rule 29 4 you should be kept informed by political groups of any Members who have joined a new political group or who have left a political group. Have you received any notification of any Members leaving the Group of the European People s Party or does the Austrian People s Party ORG continue to sit in that political group? SPEAKER ID 13 CARDINAL NAME President Mr Corbett PERSON I have not received any notification. SPEAKER ID 14 LANGUAGE DE NAME Poettering Madam President I am amazed at Mr Corbett s reaction. He should find other ways of raising his profile than expressing views on such matters here. P P We are solidly with our Austrian NORP friends who have proven to be good Europeans NORP in the past. They have our full support. P Applause P CHAPTER ID 2 Agenda SPEAKER ID 15 CARDINAL NAME President With regard to the agenda for Thursday DATE following a request made yesterday DATE in plenary I propose extending the debate on topical and urgent subjects of major importance by half an hour to TIME 6.00 p.m. TIME when the vote will take place. P Parliament ORG gave its assent CHAPTER ID 3 Commission LAW s strategic objectives and legislative programme SPEAKER ID 16 CARDINAL NAME President The next item is the joint debate on the Commission ORG statements on its strategic objectives for the coming five years DATE and the annual DATE legislative programme for 2000 DATE . P I therefore immediately give the floor to the President of the Commission Mr Prodi. SPEAKER ID 17 LANGUAGE IT NAME Prodi Madam President ladies and gentlemen a five year DATE programme is an extremely important undertaking and this is why I preferred that you be given the unabridged text of the speech which is available in four CARDINAL languages. P To respect my speaking time I will confine myself to referring only to the broad outlines of my programme a programme for the dawning of a new legislature and a new century DATE when it is right and proper to see Europe LOC in a broader perspective a Europe LOC which is currently in a paradoxical situation. Let us remember that for half a century DATE Europe LOC has provided us with peace security and freedom and a united Europe LOC has also contributed to giving us a period of unprecedented prosperity. P We are now seeing the beginning of a strong recovery which it appears may even be sustainable for a good while yet if we are prudent with our policies. This recovery is the logical consequence of the efforts we have made but it comes at a price it follows the restructuring of public accounts in European NORP countries which have kept inflation under control with a policy wisely intended to control costs and increase productivity in a Europe LOC that has begun a vigorous restructuring of its own industries banks and public services even though this process is not yet complete and still has a long way to go. P Nevertheless despite these aspects European NORP citizens are disappointed and concerned by unemployment which is not falling quickly enough by a Europe LOC trailing behind in technology and seemingly falling even further behind and in particular a scientific sector which is starting to lag a long way behind too by the European NORP institutions which appear distant and do not seem to be in step with the times starting with the Commission ORG itself. The crisis in the Commission was in fact a crucial point in the relationship between Europe LOC and its citizens and the low turnout at the European NORP elections was a worrying indication of this. P Even stronger still however is the sense of insecurity the feeling of being unprepared in a new world that is moving forwards a world which is completely changing where globalisation will even end up changing our points of reference. This is not the first ORDINAL time this has happened Europe LOC was once confronted with a similar transformation an explosion of its markets a change in its points of reference and a different view of the world. I am referring to the sixteenth century DATE when the discovery of America GPE turned everything upside down. Some countries such as France GPE and Spain GPE managed to meet the challenge giving rise to great nation States GPE other countries such as Italy GPE did not meet this challenge and lost all the headway that they had accumulated during the first ORDINAL part of that millennium headway in science technology economic progress defence structures and military organisation philosophy and literature. P Today Europe LOC is facing a similar challenge and we know that just as history has been unforgiving in the past it will not be forgiving in the present. P In this context of wholesale change and in order to prevent our nation States GPE vanishing again in the wake of globalisation which is creating hitherto unprecedented scales and challenges Europe LOC needs to be economically strong because globalisation demands unity because every day we hear news of new agreements at world level and news of changes at European NORP level too. But more vital still is a Europe LOC that feels strong in the political arena. P In years DATE past the single market and the single currency have been the pivotal point of our actions the mainstay of European NORP life. Today DATE the new frontiers of European NORP integration are political frontiers common foreign and security policy justice and internal security and to a lesser extent the crucial question of the fundamental political values on which our coexistence is based. P The Commission has therefore adopted the strategic programme for 2000 2005 DATE a programme that was immediately sent to the European Parliament ORG and with which you are already familiar so I will not go into detail about it now. Some of you may find it lacks detail but no political structure sets out detailed five year DATE programmes. This is the European Union ORG not the Soviet Union GPE . P Our programme highlights the major points of reference the major areas for action firstly the development of new forms of governance for Europe LOC secondly ORDINAL extension and enlargement of the area of peace freedom and security thirdly the launch of a new stage in the growth of the economy fourthly safeguarding and improving quality of life. These will be our major guidelines for action over the next five years DATE . P With regard to the first ORDINAL area new forms of governance for Europe LOC you already know that the Commission has undertaken to produce a White Paper ORG and not a full legislative text since in the light of major issues which are changing the structure of the way we interact the Commission is first ORDINAL of all preparing for a debate we will subsequently discuss the content with you this will give rise to a policy document and finally a legislative document. This is an effective transparent way to proceed and involve all the European NORP institutions and the citizens of Europe LOC . P This White Paper is a response to the challenges that enlargement is forcing on us an enlargement that is forcing us to rethink the workings of all our institutions rethink our very policies all our policies and above all rethink what we must continue to do at Union level when the Member States number 25 CARDINAL or 30 and what will be the best thing to do at individual State level at regional level and at local government level. But it is not only enlargement that is urging us towards this rethink as I said a few moments ago TIME it is also economic and political globalisation itself. P We must govern Europe LOC in such a way as to make us more efficient to bring us closer to the citizens and to encourage everyone to get involved starting with the important issue of the involvement of women. One CARDINAL of the main differences in the comparison made recently between Europe LOC and the United States GPE was not so much job mobility or risk capital as women s involvement in economic life an issue that has much more prominence in the United States GPE than in Europe LOC . This is a field where Europe LOC has nevertheless always been in the vanguard. We therefore need to reflect on this at length and with an open mind and all the institutions Commission Parliament Council ORG will have to consider their own roles and their own policies. We shall therefore get straight back to work on this White Paper although in order to finish it we shall have to wait for the results of the Intergovernmental Conference ORG and it will therefore not be ready until spring 2001 DATE . It will not be a philosophical Paper but a practical Paper full of focused proposals. P We the Commission are the first ORDINAL to know that we must have a total rethink and we shall therefore do two CARDINAL things we are and will continue to be fully committed to internal reform and we shall rethink our policies in detail. P I have asked all the Commissioners and I shall ask them once again in a still more analytical way to pinpoint all the activities that we can forgo. The Commission must define what its fundamental activities are what it must concentrate on and shed its non essential activities thereby freeing up new resources and ensuring a more correct and co operative relationship with individual countries regions and local communities. P So we shall be freeing up new resources but I fear and I want to state this before Parliament ORG the time will come when these new resources that we are already freeing up will in turn be insufficient in terms of allowing us to address our new tasks I am thinking of enlargement the new sector of justice and home affairs health issues and environmental matters. When that time comes when we have used up all our resources I shall not hesitate to come here before you to request further resources but what I am saying now is that if we are not given these necessary resources we shall have to refuse to take on any new duties because the available resources will not be commensurate with the new tasks that we will be taking on. P As for internal reform you well know how committed my Commission has been to this since day one. I know full well that we will not be able to achieve any political objective if the Commission does not undertake vigorous and comprehensive internal reform if it does not become more efficient if it does not increase efficiency in all sectors starting with the sector in which the worst backlogs have built up in the past external aid. Providing aid rapidly when it is needed saves human lives in many cases providing it late is worse than not providing it at all. P When I speak about external aid my thoughts immediately turn to the Balkans LOC . There is cause for hope thanks to the commitment of our workers on the ground an extraordinary commitment given our organisational problems. My thoughts also turn to Bernard Kouchner PERSON s efforts of the stability pact that we all vigorously support with total dedication but I also think of new events such as Croatia GPE where the situation has changed in a few weeks DATE the European NORP institutions immediately opened the way to dialogue with this country and received the news knowing full well that the only way to resolve not only Bosnia GPE s problems but more particularly Serbia GPE s problems is to throw a curtain of democracy around Serbia GPE . This is the new element that we must help to bring to the Balkans LOC . P We must increase our efficiency in this area. We must reopen the Danube to boats. It is contradictory to offer aid to Romania GPE and Bulgaria GPE yet leave these countries unable to harness their greatest resource. We must decontaminate the river and in view of this over the next few days DATE the Commissioner responsible for the environment will be putting forward specific plans to monitor this serious problem. P We have done a lot in the Balkans LOC the new European Reconstruction Agency ORG for Kosovo GPE the Balkans Task Force and new regulations to speed up procedures. Nevertheless we definitely have to do more. We must liberalise trade within the region and between the region and the European Union ORG we must contribute to building infrastructural links that will end its centuries DATE old isolation we must intensify efforts to build a democratic pluralist society in these countries with institutions public structures police forces and a structured civil society but above all we must press these countries to work together in the context of a united region as regards both politics and the economy. If we do not do this we shall have failed in our duty. Remember that the Marshall Plan LAW was not effective simply because of the scale of its resources it was even more effective because it made us Europeans NORP work together towards a new horizon it gave us a fresh outlook in terms of our politics and our economy. This is what we need to do for the Balkans LOC . Europe LOC must prove in the Balkans LOC and the rest of the world its ability to extend the area of security peace and freedom and its ability to take a leading role on the international stage. P We are clearly once again returning to enlargement which must be put into practice in tandem with the extension of the area of security peace and freedom. We have made many promises in this regard but I believe we shall succeed in keeping our promises even though we have a very delicate path to tread. Indeed enlargement which will be with us for our five years DATE in office and beyond I am referring to the aspirations of applicant countries must hinge on concrete objective criteria and also on reassuring public opinion in the countries involved and to an even greater degree public opinion in our own Member States. P There will be friendship calm openness but also a certain strictness in the enlargement process. I repeat we must reassure public opinion in those countries that wish to join but we need to provide public opinion in our own Member States with even greater reassurance. P Our responsibilities do not stop at enlargement or at the Balkans LOC . There are certain other key issues relations with Ukraine GPE relations with Russia GPE relations with neighbouring countries and more importantly the important question of relations with the southern Mediterranean LOC which will be a crucial point for European NORP history and for security and peace in Europe LOC for future generations. In this regard we have a responsibility towards the whole of Africa LOC . In recent times Africa LOC has raised hopes and has received offers of help but nothing tangible has yet been achieved. In recent years DATE in Africa LOC we have not seen a shift from totalitarian regimes to democracy but quite the contrary a shift from democracy to totalitarian regimes. Africa LOC is for us a worrying topic for discussion. We therefore have another duty at international level which has already been proposed by the Commissioner responsible for trade the undertaking to relaunch the Millennium Round EVENT and to take on some fundamental problems affecting the poorest countries not just in terms of writing off debts but also via the unilateral opening up to trade with the poorest countries in the world with a great deal of willingness on our part which we had already proposed prior to Seattle GPE but which we could not put into practice. P We need to provide alternative answers otherwise episodes such as those seen in Seattle GPE will be repeated over and over and will come to hamper one of Europe LOC s positive roles in history. All over the world Europe LOC s actions must be guided by a deep respect for the principles of freedom and respect for the rights of individuals and minorities. We should remember that we the European Union ORG are a union of minorities we are all a minority within Europe LOC . There are concerns even within the Fifteen PERSON concerns which may even surface again in the next decade DATE . I am referring to the situation in Austria GPE where the Commission ORG has remained true to its role being duty bound to work towards the cohesion of the Union but also the unwavering guardian of the Treaties ready to punish every minor breach of the principles of democracy law and respect for minorities. Some people have criticised me over the congratulatory message I sent to Chancellor Sch ssel. My message to you is do not take the necessary and proper courtesies of form to mean that I have been less firm in the content. Reread the letter The reference to the fundamental values of the Union is taken and this is more than mere coincidence from Article 6 of the Treaty LAW I repeat Article 6 of the Treaty LAW . P I would also ask you whether you believe that any other European NORP head of government has ever been reminded of these principles by the Commission when they were elected. This is what we wish to do maintain our role as a supranational structure maintain the role conferred on us by the Treaties but also be unwavering on principles and make judgements based on facts. P Last November DATE the Commission tabled a proposal for an anti racism directive. I would ask the Council ORG to adopt it swiftly and I would ask Parliament ORG to help us with this action which will further strengthen the fundamental bases of our social cohesion. P I will quickly conclude by mentioning the last two CARDINAL points of our programme the economy and quality of life. I have already talked about the economy we well know which basic ingredients will set Europe LOC on the path towards a lasting recovery which will in turn create more jobs. We must continue to keep inflation under control proceed with liberalisation ensure more competition encourage the dissemination of information technology and all new technologies push forward with science and push back scientific boundaries and develop an appetite for being at the cutting edge of science. The forthcoming Lisbon Summit ORG on these issues dissemination of technology employment will be a decisive summit. It has taken four years DATE for us to be in a position to hold a summit of this kind. We are at last holding it and cannot let this opportunity slip through our fingers. P Finally our last commitment is to improve quality of life. We have opened this chapter with the White Paper on Food Safety ORG we now need to make significant headway in the environment sector. The Erika PERSON oil slick and the contamination of the Danube ORG demonstrates the pressing need for European NORP scale intervention to safeguard the environment. The time has come to discuss and then establish a body for emergency civil protection in Europe LOC . All too often we find ourselves calling for this after a disaster has occurred. I think it would be appropriate to begin thinking about these things before disasters happen. P These are the challenges that we the Commission but also all the other European NORP institutions are facing. How will we judge ladies and gentlemen Madam ORG President the five years DATE of our mandate? How are we going to assess the results of these five years DATE ? I do not know but one benchmark we could certainly use is the challenge we must take up together. Let us take a very simple parameter turnout at the next European NORP elections. If it is higher than at the previous elections it will mean that we have successfully met our challenge. P Madam ORG President ladies and gentlemen we are faced with all these major political challenges but precisely because of the recovery that is now underway we are also faced with major opportunities. This ladies and gentlemen could be the decade DATE of Europe LOC . Indeed I would say that this must be the decade DATE of Europe LOC . SPEAKER ID 18 LANGUAGE DE NAME Poettering Madam President Mr President of the Commission the Group of the European People s Party ORG Christian Democrats NORP and European Democrats NORP welcomes this debate and we welcome the fact that the Commission submitted a document so that we could prepare for the debate. We also welcome the conclusions which we find in this document. And we welcome the broad outlines of the speech which President Prodi PERSON has just given. We read in the conclusions in the document that the five year DATE term of office of the Prodi Commission ORG will be a time of major changes. Europe LOC will press ahead with integration at the same time the Union will start an enlargement process which will in the end reunite our continent. P A demanding ambitious perhaps even prophetic task and we wish you every success Mr President of the Commission. However we consider that the present is the basis of the future and we shall only be able to shape the future if we prove our worth in the present. I say that in all earnestness and I have chosen my words carefully. I refer to the current debate on the present conflicts in the European Union ORG . We in the European Union ORG are one CARDINAL Community ORG . We belong together even when there are problems. Now is not the time to isolate but to unite and to complete together the task of unifying Europe LOC . P P Mr President of the Commission you have represented and defended the European Parliament ORG time and again over recent weeks DATE . You have seen yourself as the guardian of the Treaties and that is indeed your role. For that and for the letter to the Federal Chancellor of the Republic of Austria GPE which you mentioned we expressly respect acknowledge and support you. P Applause P Mr President of the Commission our objectives are one and the same we want a strong Europe LOC in the twenty first century DATE a democratic Europe LOC which is able to act. A Europe LOC which defends its values of human dignity and democratic rule of law both internally and to the outside world and at the same time looks after its global interests with dignity patience and convincing self confidence. Europe LOC s message the European Union ORG s message to the world should not be one of arrogance or even European NORP nationalism no it must be one of cooperation partnership and peaceful development. P Globalisation gives us the chance to shape the world which is becoming smaller and smaller as a world of peaceful competition and solidarity. Seen in this light globalisation is more of an opportunity than a danger more of a coming together than a segregation more mutual enrichment than separation. But we also know that we can only shape the huge challenge of globalisation together as Europeans NORP . Globalisation is not only an economic process it is also a cultural process which is why we say we want partnership in the world we do not want the clash of civilisations which many are predicting we want partnership a meeting exchange and peace. But we also say we want to defend this European Community ORG of tolerance which is why a common foreign security and defence policy is so important. P Negotiations with six CARDINAL central European NORP countries are starting today DATE bringing the European NORP family a step closer together. We agree with what you said about the Barcelona GPE process. All the countries in the Mediterranean LOC area must acknowledge human dignity democracy and the rule of law. For us the Group of the European People s Party ORG and the European NORP Democrats NORP it is not only the reform of the institutions of the European Union ORG which will be important in the next five years DATE it is also important that we declare our faith in the single European NORP currency and use the policy of stability as a basis for consolidating the European NORP currency in coming years DATE . We therefore take the uncompromising view that we must maintain a resolute and consistent stability pact. P We need structural reforms in the European NORP economy. Most importantly we need to restore a European NORP economy in which performance pays and people can work as entrepreneurs. It would be Europe LOC s undoing if we were to end up with just a few multinationals and no future for small and medium sized businesses in Europe LOC . P Applause The Commission has an important role to play here by getting a coordinated policy under way with the nation states to reduce taxes so that entrepreneurship pays. We too want to help put Europe LOC on its feet. P You spoke in your paper of decentralisation and subsidiarity. We support that. The nations regions towns and communities of Europe LOC will be preserved. However there is a current trend the fauna flora habitat directive was quoted as an example which in my country at least creates the impression that associations are bypassing national and regional institutions and submitting programmes to Brussels GPE and that Brussels GPE is then making decisions affecting the property of countless agricultural holdings in the countries of the European Union ORG . I merely mention it as an example of where we must take care and where I would recommend that we try to achieve more legal security in the future. P Mr President of the Commission allow me to close with these words as the Group of the European People s Party and the European NORP Democrats NORP we have every interest in a strong Commission. If you are persuasive in your actions we all reap the benefits. In this respect we wish you every success. However we are also aware of our role as the Commission s watchdog. If we have the merest suspicion that you are failing to safeguard the law of the European Union ORG and at present we have no cause for complaint on the contrary we acknowledge that this is not the case but if European NORP law is infringed then we shall fight any such infringement uncompromisingly precisely because peace in the European Union ORG is founded on this law. We must preserve this law and peace in the European Union ORG if we are to be able to go forth as peacemakers in the world. P Applause SPEAKER ID 19 LANGUAGE ES NAME Bar n Crespo Madam ORG President Mr President of the Commission ladies and gentlemen first ORDINAL of all I would like to welcome the presentation of and the first ORDINAL ever debate on the Commission ORG s programme for government the word President Prodi PERSON is so fond of as I am for the whole legislature. P Firstly ORDINAL this is welcome because it explains to our fellow citizens what we are intending to do and what we are already doing. We must also express our regret at the current situation and try to improve on it for the future. We have taken almost eleven months DATE President Prodi PERSON was nominated at the Berlin Summit FAC in March last year DATE to establish a legislative programme. This is not entirely President Prodi s fault. We are recovering from a crisis. However I believe that in the future it would be appropriate for the investiture of the next Commission to coincide with the presentation of a legislative programme. We are breaking new ground and doing so in complex circumstances. P President Prodi PERSON began his speech by talking of a paradoxical situation a paradox in the European Union ORG and also throughout the world we are at the dawn of a new secular millennium dominated by the web of the Internet and the sorcery of biotechnological advance and we are living through a genuine change of epoch. However to focus on the European Union ORG as it is today DATE and on the subject of government and governance a word which at least in Spanish NORP brings to mind the previous name of the Ministry of Internal Affairs ORG although it may be an appropriate word anyway the most important thing is that the European Union ORG be provided with a good government and since President Prodi PERSON always defends his home town Bologna PERSON I would advise him to go to Siena ORG for a while and see something which we all understand the frescos of Ambrogio Lorenzetti FAC which speak of bon governo FAC good government and mal governo bad government . What we need here is good government Madam ORG President. P Since we are recovering from a very complex crisis we must try to enhance our institutions and give them substance. I would like to remind the House ORG of something which we often forget and that is that the investiture of the Prodi Commission ORG last September DATE received wide support. In our opinion this demonstrates that the majority of us are in favour of progress and in favour of Europe LOC . I would like to point out that within this broad consensus there were some Groups ORG which said that the majority of Parliament ORG should form an opposition to the majority of the Council ORG . It is precisely this which in a sense is hindering the important process of developing codecision within the legislative programme. I am pointing this out because I believe that our support for the Commission ORG also has to lead to continuity in the work carried out throughout the legislature. P On the other hand we are witnessing the birth of a political Europe LOC which entails a collection of shared values which we all agree upon and a European Union ORG at the service of the citizens. With regard to the events of recent days DATE I would like to say and I am saying this on the day DATE and the week that the Intergovernmental Conference ORG is starting we have to place far more value and fundamental emphasis upon the charter on fundamental rights which given what we have said about the Austrian NORP crisis I believe should be fully included in the Treaties. I have absolutely no doubt about this and I believe it is an essential point. P In this regard Madam President I would like to say that we should remain aware and watch our language. Last week DATE the new Minister for Finance of the Austrian NORP coalition described the Austrian Parliament ORG as a farce and a theatre. Those of us who have had to live under a dictatorship know of the existence of dictatorships with cardboard governments. There can be no democracy without a living parliament. I believe that this type of language is extremely dangerous and I would like to condemn it here and now. P With regard to the four CARDINAL great priorities which President Prodi systematically refers to and with regard to his analysis of the challenges facing us I would say that we are very much in agreement. Nevertheless I would point out to the Commission that as far as the Socialist Group ORG is concerned there has been a change of priorities. We understand that the first ORDINAL priority is the economic and social agenda which also includes what is known as quality of life priorities that is to say the rights of citizens as consumers and as people in relation to those questions which we always talk about but never give sufficient priority to that is the European NORP social model and its adaptation to the new circumstances consumer rights respect for the environment and sustainable development. P When speaking of the commitment to full employment we have to bear in mind that these days DATE full employment does not mean what it meant in the era of Beveridge EVENT at the end of the Second World War EVENT that is to say employment for the male head of the household. We must argue for equality of the sexes the famous gender mainstreaming which is one of the least developed questions in the Prodi Commission ORG s programme. This means prioritising sex equality the adaptation of the social model and above all an unequivocal fight against populism whenever our economic and social cohesion is under threat. This must also be a main priority in the work of the Commission. It must be complemented with a forthright fight against racism and intolerance so that we may come to recognise in practice the evolution of a Union which has become a magnet for the rest of the world and an immigration zone given its prosperity and seasonal demographics. I believe that this is the first ORDINAL objective for us to pursue. P In this respect I would also add another element which is economic government given the single currency and I believe this is inescapable. This is another question on which the Commission must make progress. With regard to the ambitious objectives and above all the Commission ORG s important step of adopting this broadening of the process of negotiation and integration I would like and my Group would like more clarification in relation to the revision of Agenda 2000. Does the Commission think that there will be never be any revision? The issue of taxation also seems to us to be absolutely essential. P With regard to governance in general I believe it might be worth thinking in theoretical terms. I would like to remind you of one thing it is dangerous to rethink the entire governance of the European Union ORG from here. I would be clearly in favour of subsidiarity. If we are capable of defining what our area of governance is I think that would be very positive. In all other areas I believe that subsidiarity is also relevant to this discussion. Not only should the Commission ORG discuss this but also our states our parliaments and our civil society. P Madam ORG President I would like to refer briefly to the last objective which seems to us to be absolutely fundamental the stabilisation of the continent and the strengthening of the Europe LOC s role in the world. It appears that there is agreement and support with regard to the prioritisation of South East Europe LOC with regard to enlargement and as I have said already with regard to the process of integration and the strengthening of the Euro Mediterranean ORG programme and our ability to prevent conflicts as well as an issue which we seldom talk about the North South LOC challenge. We must not forget Africa LOC a continent which has been forsaken not only by God but also by Europe LOC nor our important contribution to cooperating with development. P Lastly an issue for which we are increasingly responsible as the world s foremost economic and commercial power that is Europe LOC s voice in the world which does not simply mean adopting an active approach to the Millennium Round ORG . It means the reform of the United Nations ORG and the international financial institutions for which Europe LOC has an enormous responsibility. Above all Madam President and here I will end we must be able to express this in plain language clearly by changing to some extent the jargon ORG which we use because we cannot ask the Europeans NORP who are living through profound changes to take part and show enthusiasm towards us if we continue to use a form of language which they find completely inaccessible. This is a fundamental way to increase and strengthen their confidence in us. I hope this will be demonstrated when we hold the next European NORP elections. SPEAKER ID 20 CARDINAL NAME Cox Mr President of the Commission may I say to you on behalf of my group that we very much support the point of departure the core of the analysis and the strategy that you bring to this House ORG today DATE that is that the stakes now are irrefutably political. They are political because we are moving on. Even though we have not yet finished constructing all the economic building blocks we are moving on from that kind of functionalist building of Europe LOC to a much more challenging political perspective. P The challenge of enlargement is political. The challenge of creating an area of justice and home affairs of dealing with asylum and immigration and crime is very political. The challenge of a common foreign security and defence policy is very political. Because it is political it is more complex. Because it is political it is more sovereignty sensitive. Because it is more sovereignty sensitive it is more voter and citizen sensitive. We need therefore to find a way forward towards these political ends and objectives to address not merely the scepticism but the greatest enemy the apathy which you identify. P The means of achieving this are difficult but they are real. I applaud your view that we need more synergy between our institutions not just between Commission ORG and Parliament ORG but also between these and the Council ORG to underscore the extent of the political challenge. We need more dialogue not just with each other but also with civil society. We need more explanation of what Europe LOC is about. We need to be able to confront fears and anxieties because in many instances the greatest fear is fear itself. Perhaps with more dialogue and explanation we can overcome some of that. P My group is especially attracted to the creative possibilities you signal in regard to the prospect of a White Paper ORG next spring addressing the issue of governance. As we look at the Europe LOC of networking which you describe it is very important that Europe LOC concentrates on its core business that we have the courage to suggest areas where Europe LOC may perhaps stand back. That could convince people that Europe LOC in its governance is not something run exclusively from Brussels GPE which concentrates and soaks up more powers more decisions more authority. That is the political core of the challenge and I think you have identified it well before this House ORG today DATE . P For my group enlargement is the first ORDINAL priority against which all the other possibilities for reform must be measured be they governance be they the intergovernmental conference be they reform of the institutions. P We see enlargement as a process of partnership not a process of them and us . We see enlargement as a positive sum gain for member and candidate states. I suggest to the Commission as a repository of an enormous amount of detailed information on enlargement to present a document that explains the value of enlargement not just in budgetary and financial terms but in a broader sense a document like the Cecchini PERSON report before the Single Act LAW that explains to people in a way which engages them in the debate that this is the grand historic challenge facing Europe LOC today DATE . We need to be able to prepare that ground carefully. P On south eastern Europe LOC I agree with your view that we measure political institutions through their achievements. In the lifetime of this Commission DATE and this Parliament ORG we must succeed in the task of winning the difficult and uneasy peace in south eastern Europe LOC . We applaud the stabilisation and association agreements but we would like to see more. We will publish this material and bring it forward in the debate on the Swoboda PERSON report later this week DATE . P The strategic paper emphasises the global role of the European Union ORG . Our central aim must be to give the Union a weight in global affairs commensurate with its weight in terms of aid trade and finance. At the beginning of this decade DATE we must foresee how our institutions will develop internationally by its end and notably where we fit into international monetary bodies where we fit into UN ORG agencies and so on. We need to open that debate. P In conclusion this morning TIME the day after St Valentine PERSON s Day the newspapers are saying that your honeymoon period is over. I do not know whether you are a romantic or not Mr Prodi. Perhaps this is a very unromantic thing to say on such a morning TIME . However we in the Liberal Group ORG welcome this because it means we are now settling down to business. That is the way it should be. Regarding the many adjectival descriptions of Europe LOC you addressed in your speech an energetic Europe LOC an enterprising Europe LOC a Europe LOC that has a human face and is inclusive let me in a word dear to the heart of my Liberal colleagues give in one CARDINAL adjective one CARDINAL description of the kind of Europe LOC we want to see in your plan for governance an enabling Europe LOC . P SPEAKER ID 21 CARDINAL NAME Hautala Madam PERSON President Mr President of the Commission I greatly admire the openness with which you admit that the European Union ORG must change fundamentally. You gave consideration to important questions of principle in your programme. I believe that the public will start to show more interest in politics if we can tackle the major issues alongside the day to day DATE ones. At the same time however it has to be said that unfortunately your programme reminds me in many ways of a party manifesto. There are a lot of good intentions in it but it very much lacks concrete proposals concerning how this can all be achieved. As in any other party manifesto it is full of contradictions. I would like to take this opportunity to help you recognise them. P First let me speak about the economy and social development. We have to be able to think hard about how we can coordinate the aim of competitiveness with the aim of full employment that is what was mentioned in your programme. Should we at long last be drafting convergence criteria in which as you in fact hint at in this programme the aim would be that unemployment in no Member State should be higher than say the three CARDINAL most successful countries in this matter? Ecological tax reform is what my group would like to stress the importance of because we can only create employment and sustainable development by changing our taxation structure. But unfortunately as we all know this is an area where the European Union ORG is totally unable to act. Do please raise this issue at the intergovernmental conference. The EU ORG can only achieve authority in the fact that it focuses on tasks that individual countries cannot attend to alone. In this respect Parliament ORG will definitely defend along with yourselves the importance of supranational decision making. P One CARDINAL contradiction within your programme relates to globalisation. I think it is very creditable that you should mention the concept of global administration as others too have said here. However please learn from the events of Seattle GPE we have to be able to combine the freedom in world trade on the one hand with all those values of human importance that we wish to defend on the other. You must embark on a dialogue with the international community. Do please try to make the international organisations democratic. The European Union ORG could be critically important in a process in which the United Nations ORG and the WTO ORG really do become subject to democratic monitoring. We can submit motions for this together with you. P Finally I consider it a very positive sign that you speak so often about the civil society although unfortunately this is another contradiction. You ought to also be able to draw conclusions at the IGC ORG . We have to table motions proposing that our citizens might really have a direct impact on decision making. What you just said is absolutely true people want more engaged democracy. In my opinion this is the only way if we want to gain the approval of the people with regard to Europe LOC and their interest in Europe LOC too. SPEAKER ID 22 CARDINAL NAME Wurtz Madam ORG President my group was one of those which wanted to have a document allowing an exchange of views on the Commission ORG s strategic objectives within the group before this debate instead of being reduced to an on the spot reaction in plenary. The main merit of the text of this communication is therefore the fact that it exists. We are also pleased to see certain statements and intentions which it contains and which Mr Prodi has just underlined and in some cases usefully clarified. P The current globalisation process is and I quote exclusive rather than inclusive and has widened the inequalities . The European Union ORG s objective must therefore be to help define new ground rules within the Union and in international relations. Clearly many citizens are disenchanted and anxious about the lack of real and lasting solutions to basic problems such as unemployment and social exclusion which affect our very existence. This must be one of our absolute priorities. We do need to rethink many aspects of current Community ORG policy if the important and difficult project of enlargement is to be a success. We also need distinctive strategic partnerships with our neighbours to the south and east in order to achieve stability and peace. There are plenty of areas for serious discussion. We will carefully study the planned White Papers WORK_OF_ART and will participate constructively in the work begun or promised. P It is in this spirit that I have three CARDINAL criticisms to make. These must be taken into account if we are truly to shape the new Europe LOC as proclaimed ambitiously by the title of the Commission document and Mr Prodi s speech and do so in reality not rhetoric. P The first ORDINAL and most serious criticism concerns the Commission ORG s propensity for rather grandiloquent self satisfaction with regard to the European Union ORG and for a cursory and even condescending view of our partners. The perfect illustration of this crippling flaw lies in the opening sentence of the Commission ORG communication. This talks of the European Union ORG as living proof that peace stability freedom and prosperity can be brought to a continent and as a model showing the world the way forward. It concludes that our neighbours have the chance to join this prosperity and we have a golden opportunity to enable them to do so . A more balanced and more rigorous diagnosis would be welcome in my view. Similarly the idea that the euro has fostered a consensus on wage moderation is not really borne out by the repeated nervous orders issued by the European Central Bank ORG to the trade unions which are deemed to be too demanding. P My second ORDINAL criticism follows on from the first ORDINAL . This extreme difficulty in seeing the contradictions of the current situation and where necessary confronting these is seriously limiting the will duly confirmed by Mr Prodi to grant public demands. For example at least in the countries which I know well I doubt that the intention repeated three CARDINAL or four CARDINAL times in the Commission document to reform Europe LOC s social protection health care and pension systems ...in a climate of more cautious public spending will meet the needs of those whose confidence we apparently want to win back. P My third ORDINAL criticism stems from the first ORDINAL two CARDINAL . The weakness of the analysis and the obstacles to the necessary changes have resulted in a project whose scope is severely limited by an overabundance of generalisations a rather indecisive approach and therefore a lack of impetus. But all is not lost. This is a starting point and we have five years DATE to succeed provided that the political will exists and is expressed with sufficient force and clarity. My group is fully intent on helping with this work. SPEAKER ID 23 CARDINAL NAME Collins Madam ORG President reforming and democratising the institutions of the European Union ORG are central to the historic and moral challenge of the enlargement process. This was the opening statement of Commission ORG President Prodi PERSON when he presented the strategic objectives of the European Commission ORG for the next five years DATE . P We await the White Paper on the governance of the European Union ORG dealing with the issue of balance between Member States governments and the European Union ORG institutions which is to be published this summer DATE . On this specific point I think it is important that we address the reform of the internal decision making procedures of the Commission. The Commission ORG in its proposals to the forthcoming intergovernmental conference has indicated that its preference lies in seeing smaller Member States lose their automatic right to nominate a member of the European Commission ORG . This is a scenario whereby the European Union ORG has a membership of over 25 CARDINAL Member States. P I do not want to see a two CARDINAL tier European Union ORG built. I believe this would fly in the face of the spirit and objective of the Treaty of Rome GPE and all subsequent treaties. There must be equality in terms of national representation within the Commission and within all the other European NORP institutions. I would like to remind those who seek to eliminate the right of small Member States to nominate a European NORP Commissioner that the United States of America GPE gives smaller states the same recognition as larger states in the United States GPE Senate ORG . More or less each of the 50 CARDINAL states in the US GPE has two CARDINAL elected positions in the United States GPE Senate ORG regardless of its population. P Any future reforms of the European Union ORG treaties will require a referendum to be held in my country. It would be very difficult for those who propose a yes vote in any such future treaty to win the support of the Irish NORP people if we lose our right to have our nominee to the European Commission ORG . P Undoubtedly reform of the European Council ORG is also going to be included in this White Paper on the governance of the European Union ORG which will be published this summer DATE . Once again there are special areas of policy making which should be left to the domain of the national Member States. I do not believe that there is broad support in Europe LOC for the introduction of qualified majority voting on taxation justice and home affairs and foreign affairs at European Union ORG level. P At present under Article 99 of the Treaty of Rome LAW decisions taken at EU ORG level concerning tax changes must be by unanimity. I believe that this proposal should remain as a common European NORP taxation code would diminish rather than enhance the workings of the European Union ORG . P I support the enlargement of the European Union ORG . I support institutional changes so as to ensure that enlargement of the Union takes place in a streamlined and structured manner. However we must remember that the public opinion of 370 million CARDINAL people in the European Union ORG is a vital factor in changing the EU ORG treaties. Changes should not be brought about too quickly and cannot be too sweeping otherwise public opinion will make ratification of any future European Union ORG treaty very difficult indeed. SPEAKER ID 24 LANGUAGE CARDINAL IT NAME Dell Alba Madam President I am speaking on behalf of the Italian NORP Radical Members. President of the Commission a short while ago you said that no political structure sets out five year DATE plans. This is true if we think of Russia GPE s plans in the thirties DATE but at the start of your mandate a few months ago you yourself announced at the Conference of Presidents that you would however be presenting a legislative programme or rather the major policy lines of the European NORP government of which you are head and in the running of which we are engaged today DATE . So whether this is to be a government programme or a potential programme the breakdown of the document you distributed to us and of the accompanying speech is not much more than a list of good intentions or rather a list of issues on the table. It does not however give us the impression that the Commission is taking a clear position on any of these points but that it is just doing the European Commission ORG s duty. In this House ORG in the past large scale debates have taken place on major strategic options which the Commission ORG under its power of initiative launched not as experiments but as proposals which then made varying degrees of progress but in any case did contribute to the integration and development of the European Union ORG . P In this case Mr Prodi we certainly have a kind of Ten Commandments a whole raft of issues are listed but if I may say so we are left with the impression that the Commission is afraid to make any decision regarding what needs to be done about any of these points. There was only one point that you really stressed too much in my opinion and that was that it looks almost as if the highest priority task that you are setting yourself is to cease unnecessary activities. We should be careful though Mr Prodi because we had a crisis of confidence in the previous Commission and backed this Commission at least a parliamentary majority backed this Commission precisely because first ORDINAL and foremost the reform of the Commission would bring consolidation a new identity and a new awareness of being guided by a firm hand. P Let us consider the scenario whereby the Commission not believing itself to be equal to the task wishes or proposes to shed for example its powers to implement common policies which it is nevertheless accorded by the Treaty ORG . What do we expect from a government in any case? What do we ask of this structure the European Community ORG which is so to speak ambiguous and unique? It is right for joint resources to be controlled supranationally and not to be delegated to the Member States or the TAOs as has been the case in the past. P It seems that you are proposing the same old menu but with more unsatisfactory implications restricting the Commission so you say to the task of drawing up a few White Papers as you proposed. My fear even if you shake your head Mr Prodi is that this will translate into what some countries have thought for years DATE that the Commission should be a simple secretariat for the Council of Ministers ORG . P If this is the role that the Commission ORG intends to play over the next five years DATE we federalists are convinced we are certain that this is not the right path to take and we shall send for you and judge what the Commission ORG intends to do in this regard. The reform is important but if it aggravates the situation reduces or weakens the supranational powers of the Commission then the structure of European NORP integration as planned by the founding fathers for the European Commission ORG will be at risk. P As for the other points Mr Prodi I will take economic and social policy as an example the European NORP social model is certainly experiencing a major crisis and it is certainly not coincidental that unemployment tops the list of problems that none of our policies has managed to resolve but it is not certain that it can be resolved by going through a list of problems that we have discussed in the past without having a clear idea or proposal which takes note of the fact that Europe LOC contains economies that are growing at some of the most sustainable rates and that it is not by chance that these are the economies which have made labour market flexibility and enterprise their prime objective. If we continue to get bogged down with proposals that have given extremely poor results so far I do not know what we or the Commission will be able to do. P The same goes for enlargement as an end in itself without it being linked to a reform to make the European Union ORG and its structures much more efficient and to proposals that the Commission could have made at the IGC ORG . P Mr Prodi there is one positive thing that I would like to say to you perhaps contrary to the opinion of some Members regarding the telegram that you sent to the Austrian Government ORG . We approve of your position on this you did well not to isolate that country any further. In any case we shall see what specific steps transpire when the time comes for practical action. P Mr Prodi I repeat that this is in our opinion a slightly short sighted view. Above all it lacks drive in the sectors I have mentioned for example as regards the Balkans LOC . Can we really continue to leave the Balkans LOC out of the enlargement process disregarding the fact that Croatia GPE Macedonia and other countries also have the right to a place in this House ORG that is open to all? SPEAKER ID 25 LANGUAGE DA NAME Bonde Madam President Mr Prodi I should like to applaud your proposal for a radical decentralisation of the Union s activities and ask why then you are proposing a legislative programme which would lead to centralisation. I remember your predecessor s speech five years ago DATE . Like yourself he promised less and better but Mr Santer finished up by having delivered much more and much worse and I do not believe that you either can deliver the goods you promise. You talk about decentralisation but practise centralisation. The legislative programme is in fact a litany of subjects over which the people are to be deprived of influence and in connection with which Mr Prodi you are to take influence away from the people even on social questions. You talk about greater transparency but produce proposals which would lead to documents which at present are available for public inspection being locked away. Your Commission consists of the only 20 CARDINAL people in the EU ORG who can propose that the quantity of legislation should be reduced. Local politicians cannot do that once legislation has been passed in Brussels GPE . The legislative programme from the Commission ORG ought at least therefore to be accompanied by as long a list of tasks which are to be referred back to the Member States and to the processes of popular democracy. Otherwise the number of laws produced in Brussels GPE will just keep on growing. We have passed 10 000 QUANTITY laws and as many amendments and the applicant States have had 26 CARDINAL 000 documents sent to them which as debated by the Polish NORP parliament fill 140 CARDINAL 000 sides of paper. Even by this stage that is already too many by far. Brussels GPE should make decisions on fewer matters and hand over more decisions to the people the regions and the Member States. The only decisions which should remain with Brussels GPE are those concerning cross border issues which the national parliaments can no longer legislate on effectively. What is more the work carried out in Brussels GPE should be of a much higher quality and be completely transparent so that people might at least have some small sense of owning the process now that Mr Prodi and his predecessor have taken their autonomy away from them. I should also just like to draw Mr Dell Alba s attention to what the founding fathers of the European Union ORG dreamed of. Take a look at Jean Monet s PERSON memoirs. What he envisaged was what he called a small practical secretariat. That is not what Mr Prodi is President of today DATE . SPEAKER ID 26 CARDINAL NAME Elles Madam ORG President this morning TIME the Commission President Mr Prodi PERSON has set out ambitious goals for the European Union ORG for the next five years DATE laudable aims indeed to make a strong and effective European NORP presence felt in the world succeeding with enlargement meeting the challenge of selling e Europe LOC introducing better principles of governance. We accept that Europeans NORP particularly the younger generation need to be given a broad perspective of where Europe LOC will be in the years ahead DATE . But how are we to succeed when the resources available are limited and the credibility of our institutions is not very high? We need to match this vision with reality. Here there are three CARDINAL elements I would like to contribute. P Firstly ORDINAL we need a successful European NORP economy. We must ensure that unemployment rates continue to go down across Europe LOC confirm the trend in privatisation and deregulation encourage the insertion of information technology and knowledge of the Internet show that e Europe LOC is a good initiative. But we must avoid lurching back into the old style regulation stifling individual initiative and enterprise. We must not fear globalisation but we must also make sure that we understand its political impact in the network society. Without a successful European NORP economy we cannot meet the challenges ahead particularly of enlargement. P Secondly ORDINAL we need to ensure that we legislate only when necessary subsidiarity. Doing less but better a central plank of the last Commission needs to be the aim of this Commission too. We will be looking at this closely when we come to the annual programmes of proposed legislation. Mr Bonde was right to say that there is this image of doing less better and then suddenly we see an annual programme for the year 2000 DATE of 500 CARDINAL proposals and recommendations which seems to go in a different direction. We must establish priorities and make sure there is value for money in each of these programmes. P Lastly we need to ensure that there is proper genuine reform of the European Commission ORG . Yes the Commission guardian of the Treaties is meant to be an independent body but it also has to be accountable to European NORP citizens through our Parliament ORG . The information problem which Mr Bonde just referred to is treated like a straw in the wind with the Commission seeming to restrict information to us as citizens and as parliamentarians although we have the right to it under the Treaties. P The Commission is not in fact today DATE a European NORP government. The Commission does not reflect the majority in this particular Parliament ORG . We in Parliament ORG have a major role to play in the shaping of governance in Europe LOC . This governance therefore needs to be a sensitive governance so that we can actually work together and understand that each of the institutions in the European Union ORG has its relevant role to play. Therefore we need to have credibility coherence and confidence that in working together we can restore the image of the European Union ORG to our citizens. SPEAKER ID 27 LANGUAGE DE NAME Swoboda Madam PERSON President Mr President of the Commission numerous steps have been taken in the past to strengthen the European Union ORG from the euro to resolutions on a common security policy even to the response by the 14 the Commission and Parliament ORG to the new coalition in Austria GPE . I fully endorse the philosophy and the principles behind these decisions. Nonetheless I agree with you Mr President of the Commission that many more steps to strengthen the European Union ORG will be needed in the future because the European Union ORG is not strong enough either to master the huge inevitable task of enlargement or to control current and potential movements which to put it mildly have an ambivalent attitude towards European NORP values of democracy and tolerance and the desire to integrate all the people on our continent. That does not apply to Austria GPE alone. P The Union ORG professes its faith in its fundamental values in the Treaty of Amsterdam EVENT and the institutions of the EU ORG confirmed this faith once again when the new coalition was formed in Austria GPE . However the full potential of these values will only be realised if they are set out in comprehensive detail in and form part of the Treaty and in the final analysis represent legal claims on the part of individual citizens. When it comes down to it Articles 6 and 7 of the Treaty are not enough. In this sense the Commission must insist and I should like to endorse and confirm this here that the new Charter of Fundamental Rights WORK_OF_ART become part of the Treaty and create binding enforceable rights. In this sense the Commission must insist on building up the common area of freedom security and justice and in this sense I disagree with the last two CARDINAL speakers. P Only reasonable feasible and humane principles of immigration and asylum law can counter the irrational misleading and demagogic allegations of the extreme right. But and I would like to stress this this policy must also be accompanied by a coherent and convincing policy to promote employment and prevent social exclusion because unemployment marginalisation and growing inequality are the best breeding grounds for anti European NORP nationalistic actions and reactions. P In this respect Mr President of the Commission I too should like to address the issue of globalisation which you speculated on and how it is perceived by large segments of the population. The feeling of being at the mercy of others of lacking in influence and of having no protection from the state leads in the best case scenario to a lack of interest in politics and a refusal to vote as in the European NORP elections and in the worst case scenario to extremist voting patterns. The Union like everyone else has not yet understood how to present the EU ORG to the citizens of the EU ORG as a means of protection against the negative effects of globalisation. We are in the process of building a house but too few of our citizens really feel at home in our house. What we need are not just reforms of the World Trade Organisation ORG and the economic architecture and significantly the President of the Commission ORG forgot to mention the reform of the financial institutions and international financial architecture we also need confidence building measures for our citizens who rightly expect help and support from and in the EU ORG with the inevitable and painful process of adapting to new global circumstances. P In this respect what the Commission says about boosting Europe LOC s voice is important. You yourself Mr President spoke of a model of which unfortunately there is little mention in the document. You said that we must offer our citizens a model of economic social cultural and ecological development both internally and towards the outside world which differs from other models including the US GPE model. In this sense the USA GPE is not only our partner it is also our competitor not our opponent our competitor and we must fight to see which of us offers our citizens the best model. I hope that what we have said so clearly and vehemently here today DATE will also be reinforced in the Commission ORG documents. P SPEAKER ID 28 CARDINAL NAME Clegg Madam ORG President Mr President of the Commission the greatest legacy which your Commission could pass on to the European Union ORG would be to help resettle and redistribute the increasingly jumbled and confused powers and competences of the Commission and perhaps of the Union itself. You have made a bold start by rightly emphasising the need to focus on so called core tasks . That as you have said yourself today means that you must also identify tasks policies and programmes which are peripheral or irrelevant to the Commission ORG s main vocation. P Many existing European Union ORG policies and programmes may simply have passed their sell by date or have been proved unwieldy or ineffective when administered at European NORP level. The challenge now is to have the courage to devolve as many non core tasks as possible back to lower levels of national regional and local government. If we are to succeed in persuading a sceptical European NORP public of the merits of further European NORP integration we must be able to demonstrate that we are as active in the devolution of unwarranted EU ORG powers as we are in the evolution of new EU ORG powers. P We must not allow the critics of European NORP integration to claim as they presently do with some justification as we have just heard from Mr Bonde that the increase in EU ORG responsibilities is a one CARDINAL way street only. It must be shown to be a two CARDINAL way process in which existing EU ORG policies and programmes which are not clearly justified on the grounds of subsidiarity and proportionality are devolved and repealed. If you are able to match these aspirations with actions in the years ahead DATE you will be making an unprecedented contribution to the future of the European Union ORG as a whole and as we have heard today DATE you will enjoy widespread support in this European Parliament ORG . P SPEAKER ID 29 CARDINAL NAME Lannoye Madam ORG President Mr Prodi I fully support the thinking of the proposals made by my colleague Mrs Hautala PERSON on the Commission ORG s strategic objectives for the coming five years DATE . P I myself want to refer to a subject which has not been mentioned but which is on the agenda namely the Commission ORG s work programme for 2000 DATE . I am aware of the limitations of the exercise given that we have to work within the current Treaty and are therefore restricted by its operational rules. I am thinking in this respect of the important issue of taxation which I am not however going to talk about. Rather I want to start by welcoming certain proposals which you have made in this programme for 2000 DATE . These include all the proposals on food safety which are ambitious and important and those on maritime safety which are particularly important given the two CARDINAL oil slicks which have affected the coast of Brittany GPE and Turkey GPE . The Commission should react quickly in this respect. P However on other issues the proposals could be more ambitious and faster acting. I have some positive suggestions to make particularly on the social area the environment and the follow up to Seattle GPE . Firstly ORDINAL you have said that the citizens of Europe LOC must be reconciled with the institutions. This is self evident and it is therefore essential to find out their main concerns. For example in the social area it is not enough to announce a communication on a programme of social action. We must move faster. You must submit a new social action programme to us by the end of the year DATE . P The issue of company closures and mass redundancies is one which has been and still is very firmly in the news. We are working on the basis of a directive whose limitations have been clearly demonstrated. I therefore propose that this should be reviewed in order to produce a directive which is more effective in protecting employment and also in imposing penalties on those who do not comply. P On the environment you have announced a proposal for a decision on a sixth ORDINAL action programme on the environment. This is all very well but it seems that the text to be proposed will not contain any specific objectives or a timetable for implementation. Perhaps you can correct me on this. I personally feel that it is essential to have precise objectives and a proper timetable for implementation. In terms of civil liability for the environment it is right that we finally have a White Paper ORG . However Parliament ORG did ask for a legislative initiative six years ago DATE . The White Paper ORG clearly foreshadows this legislation but for when? You must realise that this process needs to be accelerated. P Finally after Kyoto GPE we should be able to rapidly produce precise proposals. Finally on the subject of the WTO ORG the idea of relaunching a new global round is not necessarily bad. However in the first ORDINAL place the Commission should make proposals on changing the operational rules of the WTO ORG . The Commission ORG has a role both within the EU ORG and throughout the world. The European Union ORG must therefore instigate a re evaluation of the WTO ORG s operation which must lead to precise proposals being made on its rules. SPEAKER ID 30 LANGUAGE CARDINAL IT NAME Muscardini Madam ORG President you spoke about fundamental political values and one CARDINAL of the fundamental political values even more important than democracy is respect for others. We therefore feel that you acted correctly in sending a message and that perhaps those who protested about it are still feeling the effects of Bolshevism or Nazism. Democracy means dialogue with others and making others realise when they are wrong but also listening to their explanations. P Enlargement and Alleanza Nazionale has been repeating this for ten years DATE in this House ORG must not mean dilution that is it must not entail more risks. P The applicant countries hopes are at least as important as the hopes of our current fellow citizens who are beginning to feel bitterly disappointed by the way Europe LOC works as it is not resolving the most serious problems. P We therefore need to be strict in the enlargement process and respect those agreements which should it be necessary need to be redrafted with regard to certain fundamental issues such as the environmental disaster that has occurred in Romania GPE reaching as far as Belgrade GPE but above all the continuing spread of apathy as regards major security issues. Even today DATE we do not have definite answers regarding the monitoring of the nuclear power stations in the eastern republics. P We therefore need resources available to spend before proceeding to enlargement so that we can at last establish a European NORP monitoring body responsible for monitoring quality of life and living conditions with the aim of creating a new world where such tragedies will no longer occur. P I would also like to say a few words on Africa Madam ORG President. The third ORDINAL and fourth ORDINAL worlds have been abandoned just one dollar one and a half euro DATE would be enough to save a great many children. Europe LOC which is so democratic so progressive does not speak out or take these tragic problems on board while half CARDINAL of Africa LOC is dying of Aids and other diseases. P One CARDINAL final remark regarding the Internet and globalisation. Globalisation of the economy must not be reduced to product and quality certification just as the globalisation of politics must not come to mean levelling of values or dampening of hopes and enthusiasm. The peoples which do not participate and gradually grow more distant will leave the way open for an oligarchy that will take power and leave control in the hands of a few. P As for the Internet Europe LOC has finally found the courage to say that we need rules. On a personal note please allow me at this time to congratulate the pirates who by acting the way they are are forcing the world to reflect on the only system which is currently unregulated. We live in a world of rules and regulations let us regulate the Internet too and give our fellow citizens rules and hope for the future. SPEAKER ID 31 LANGUAGE IT NAME Speroni Madam PERSON President as a Padanian NORP taxpayer I have already experienced the vice like grip of the taxman and former Prime Minister of Italy Mr Prodi since Padania GPE is liable to Italy GPE for its taxes as well. P Listening to him just now I was concerned when he mentioned new resources something that readily translates as additional taxation in view inter alia of enlargement that is the entry of new States GPE into the Union. But why do they not buy their own entrance ticket? My Padanian NORP electorate who thanks to Mr Prodi have already paid what in Italy GPE is known as the European NORP tax repaid only in part have absolutely no intention thanks once again to Mr Prodi of paying another tax for someone else. The ensuing document is both ambitious and bombastic. Is it not rather melodramatic to say that the world looks up to Europe LOC ? Moreover Europe LOC as a continent is a great deal more than just the fifteen CARDINAL EU ORG Member States. It is not rather ambitious to ensure peace democracy and human rights in the whole of Europe LOC no less? I am particularly intrigued by how the Commission considers bringing this about.
